snippet: The fee on yellow and street-hail livery taxi rides, which will take effect next year, is part of a plan to make half of the city’s yellow cabs wheelchair accessible by 2020.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration approves 30-cent surcharge on all yellow and street-hail livery taxi rides as part of plan to make half of New York City's yellow cabs wheelchair accessible by 2020; board of city’s Taxi and Limousine Commission unanimously approves rule change, which will take effect in 2015.
lead_paragraph: The fee on yellow and street-hail livery taxi rides, which will take effect next year, is part of a plan to make half of the city’s yellow cabs wheelchair accessible by 2020.

headline.main: New York City Approves 30¢ Surcharge to Pay for Accessible Taxis
headline.print_headline: City Approves 30¢ Surcharge to Pay for Accessible Taxis
